text: The 2006–07 Israeli Noar Leumit League was the 13th season since its introduction in 1994 as the top-tier football in Israel for teenagers between the ages 18–20. Beitar Jerusalem won the title, whilst Hapoel Petah Tikva and Maccabi Herzliya were relegated. The relegated teams were replaced by Ironi Kiryat Shmona (promoted from Artzit North Division)2006-2007 Artzit North Division IFA and Hapoel Ashkelon (promoted from Artzit South Division).2006-2007 Artzit South Division IFA ==Final table== ==References== ==External links== * 2006-2007 Noar Leumit League IFA *Noar Premier League 06-07 One.co.il Category:Israeli Noar Premier League seasons Youth
title: 2006–07 Israeli Noar Leumit League
